Class ScreenFader

    • destiny.core.ScreenFader

extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      ScreenFader()
      Creates a screen fader that doesnt tint at all

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScreenFader

        public ScreenFader()
        Creates a screen fader that doesnt tint at all

      • ScreenFader

        public ScreenFader(float startTint,
                   float targetTint,
                   float fadeSpeed)
        Creates a Screen fader with the given specifications about tint
        Parameters:
        startTint - The desired starting tint of the screen
        targetTint - The tint that should be reached by this fader
        fadeSpeed - The speed at which the screen fades at. This is the amount the tint is changed by each frame

    • Method Detail

      • fadeToBlack

        public void fadeToBlack()
        Sets the screen to fade to black and starts the fade

      • fadeToWhite

        public void fadeToWhite()
        Sets the screen to fade to white and starts the fade

      • fadeIn

        public void fadeIn()
        Fades the screen into becoming clear

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PApplet window)
        Applies the tint to the window
        Parameters:
        window - The PApplet that the tint will be applied to
        Postcondition:
        The given PApplet will have a tint applied to it

      • stopFade

        public void stopFade()
        Stops the fader from changing the tint applied

      • setTint

        public void setTint(float tint)
        Sets the tint of the window
        Parameters:
        tint - The tint that should be applied to the window

      • setTargetTint

        public void setTargetTint(float target)
        Sets a target tint for the Fader to reach. The Fader will automatically start to tint towards this value
        Parameters:
        target - The target tint that you wish to reach

      • isFinished

        public boolean isFinished()
        Determines if the fader has reached its target tint
        Returns:
        Whether or not the target tint is equal to the current tint of the Fader

      • ticksTillTarget

        public int ticksTillTarget()
        Calculates and returns the number of ticks till the Fader reaches its target tint
        Returns:
        The number of ticks till the target tint is reached

      • setFadeSpeed

        public void setFadeSpeed(float speed)
        Sets the speed that the fade occurs at
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed that you want the Fader to fade at

      • getTint

        public float getTint()
        Determines the current tint of the Fader
        Returns:
        The current tint of the Fader

      • addListener

        public void addListener(java.lang.Runnable listener)
        Adds a runnable block of code that will run on the event that the target tint has been reached
        Parameters:
        listener - The code that should be run in the event the target tint is reached

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener()
        Removes the code that should be run on reaching the target tint and removes the trigger on the event the target fade is reacehd

      • fadeWhite

        public void fadeWhite(boolean fade)
        Sets whether or not the window should fade to white
        Parameters:
        fade - Whether or not the window should fade to white. True means white, false means black
